item.title: Instana Setup
item.description: Initial Instana Setup Step: Create your Instana API Token Open Instana from the DemoUI and login with: User: admin@instana.local Password: P4ssw0rd! Select Settings Select API Tokens Click on Add API Token Give your API Token a unique name You may add team members to your new Slack workspace or skip this step. Click on the Eye Icon twice to copy the token. SAVE IT somewhere save, we’ll need it in the next step.

item.title: Create Application
item.description: Create RobotShop Application in Instana Task: Create RobotShop Application Documentation https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/instana-observability/current?topic=capabilities-application-perspectives In this section you will create an Application Perspective for RobotShop instance using the following parameters: Kind: Kubernetes or Container Filter: Kubernetes.Namespace = robot-shop Need Help? Create the connection On Instana homepage click New Applciation Perspective Select Kubernetes or Container Click Next Click on + Add Filter Type namespace in the search field Select robot-shop Click Next Name your Application Perspective RobotShop

item.title: Instana Integration
item.description: Integrate Instana with AIManager Task: Integrate Instana with AIManager Documentation https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-watson-aiops/3.5.1?topic=connections-instana In this section you will connect AIManager to the existing Instana instance using the following parameters: Endpoint: Your Instana URL (probably something like https://dev-aiops.<xyz>.eu-gb.containers.appdomain.cloud/) API Token: The API Token from the previous step Need Help? Create the connection In the AIManager “Hamburger” Menu select Define/Data and tool connections Click Add connection Under Instana, click on Add connection Click Connect
